intro: Tetranthera brachystachya, commonly known as the short-stalked tetranthera, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil, and thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and slender, wiry stems. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Tetranthera brachystachya is primarily of interest in botanical studies due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
